comment.body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. If you can still reproduce this issue in [Safe Mode](https://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode) then please open a new issue and fill out [the entire issue template](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/ISSUE_TEMPLATE.md) to ensure that we have enough information to address your issue. Thanks!

issue.title: atom automatic closing in mac os 10.13.4
issue.body:
I'm chinese, and my english is very poor. so, you know~

### Prerequisites

* [ ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: https://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: https://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom automatic closing in mac os 10.13.4
Atom program collapse in mac os 10.13.4

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom in mac os 10.13.4
2. Go out and smoke, about fifteen minutes
3. Returning to the desk, it has a fifty percent chance to crash.

**Expected behavior:**

I hope it's still there, and I can continue to work

**Actual behavior:**

It's closing

**Reproduces how often:** 

fifty percent

### Versions

Atom    : 1.27.1
Electron: 1.7.15
Chrome  : 58.0.3029.110
Node    : 7.9.0

issue.title: Syntax Grammar matches incorrect file
issue.body:
### Description
We have a [grammar for Singularity recipe files](https://github.com/singularityhub/language-singularity) and are having a hard time matching a file type called "Singularity.*" (starting with Singularity, and matching *just* Singularity or Singularity with some extension. [Here](https://github.com/singularityhub/language-singularity/blob/master/grammars/singularity.cson) is the cson grammar file, and specifically this doesn't seem to work:

```yaml
'fileTypes': [
    'Singularity'
    'def'
]
```
We have also tried Singularity.* but it leads to the wrong behavior in both cases. For these cases, what happens is that it recognized *all* files as Singularity after a save action (see the [issue here](https://github.com/singularityhub/language-singularity/issues/4#issuecomment-441269492)). Could you please help? Thank you!

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install the grammer
2. Create a file called Singularity and save it
3. Create other recipe files (Singularity.tag) and regular files

**Expected behavior:**
The Singularity and Singularity.tag should be highlighted

**Actual behavior:**
All files are highlighted

**Reproduces how often:** 
Always

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: https://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: https://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Versions

```bash
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.32.1
Electron: 2.0.9
Chrome  : 61.0.3163.100
Node    : 8.9.3
```
```bash
$ apm --version
apm  2.1.2
npm  6.2.0
node 8.9.3 x64
atom 1.32.1
python 3.6.4
git 2.7.4
```

### Additional Information

@tsnowlan can provide additional context, as he was helping with the issue [here](https://github.com/singularityhub/language-singularity/issues/4#issuecomment-441269492)

comment.body:
If you define fileTypes for a grammar, then each entry is only suffix matched against a given file path, meaning the fileTypes is just an array of file extensions that it is searching against. For a fileType `Singularity`, it will match either a file named `Singularity` or a file ending with `.Singularity`.

It is currently not possible to use this feature to prefix match file paths. However if the files for Singularity start with a common pattern, you might be able to use `firstLineMatch` to hint Atom to use your grammar.

issue.title: Outdenting should keep the same lines selected
issue.body:
Unindenting/outdenting/dedenting a block of code can leave you with a selection without one of the lines that you outdented, so continuing to outdent leaves that line behind.

![doublebugger](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3630663/7127253/5f86888c-e20f-11e4-8dff-18dce68689c6.gif)
~~_Also demonstrated in this gif: [gutter highlight stays behind](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/6363)_~~

Instead, it should keep part of the selection on that line. Actually, I think it should select the entire line.
If it kept only a single character selected it would be weird especially if using spaces, and if it kept only the leading whitespace selected, it would still have the problem if you dedent all the way.

_Did I miss any keywords? unindent unindented dedented dedent indentation_

issue.body:

### Description

I'm trying to have Atom (for Mac) running on an USB with full functionality except, as stated everywhere, updatability of Atom itself.

I can launch the app, I can change theme. But I can't contact the repo to install any packages or themes at all. It throws an exception.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Format USB exFAT (tried FAT32 as well)
2. Create /.atom folder
3. Add Atom.app to /
4. Launch Atom.app
5. Try to search for or install any package

**Expected behavior:**
If I search for ftp-remote-edit I expect the package to be found. Any package for that matter. Or theme.

**Actual behavior:**
Red error message box with the following output for featured (same for searching):

```
Fetching featured packages failed.Hide output…
/Volumes/ATOMICDEV/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/node_modules/npm-registry-client/lib/._access.js:1
(function (exports, require, module, __filename, __dirname) { 
                                                              
SyntaxError: Invalid or unexpected token
    at Object.exports.runInThisContext (vm.js:76:16)
    at Module._compile (module.js:542:28)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:579:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:487:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:446:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:438:3)
    at Module.require (module.js:497:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:20:19)
    at /Volumes/ATOMICDEV/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/node_modules/npm-registry-client/index.js:73:20
    at Array.forEach (native)
```

**Reproduces how often:**
100%

### Versions
Atom    : 1.22.1
Electron: 1.6.15
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm --version gives the same output as above.

### Additional Information
Packages are published to atom.io and are installed to /Volumes/ATOMICDEV/.atom/packages

It is writable, on OS X. However not on Windows, but that's another issue. So I can change to a default theme, say "One White", quit the app. Open again, and it's applied.

**The only thing that doesn't work is installing new packages.**

The end goal I had was an USB with exFAT.
/.atom
/Atom.app
/atom-windows

Where settings and packages are stored in .atom, so if I were to work on a PC I'd have everything I'd have had I worked on OS X. Problem with Windows version is that .atom isn't writable. Problem with OS X version is that I can't install packages.

I am sure I can custom install "portable atom", install what I want, then upload to the USB. But still, this issue is strange and I'm not behind a firewall or anything.

Also, "checking for updates" doesn't bug out. Only seems to be searching for packages and/or installing them that's the matter.

Any ideas?
